alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 02 at 10:56AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall that occurred overnight is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New Mexico, including the following county, Chaves. * WHEN...Until 200 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and are not passable as reported by the Hagerman Police Department. These low water crossing are along the Rio Felix east of US 285 and west of HWY 2. County roads potentially impacted include CR 17, 69, 339, 47, 20, 51 and 64. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1052 AM MDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to Runoff from overnight heavy rainfall from thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hagerman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
